name.en: Introduction to Inter Asia Cultural Studies

goal.ch: This course introduces students to the historical formations of inter-Asia cultural studies as movements, thoughts, problematics, and praxis to foreground the trajectories of inter-Asia processes. This entails our investigation of disciplinary demarcations cohered in colonial-imperial-national divides out of which cultural studies emerge, while also critically challenging the boundaries of knowledge production and social practices. Implicated in the process, we will also explore how inter-Asia comes forward and reorients our problematics about imperialism, cold wars, and decolonization long overshadowed by the Anglo-American axis. Drawing on trans-local critical thought-resources in and as a global making process, we will also explore inter-Asia methods with which to problematize “Asia,” to inquire into “inter-Asia subjectivity,” and to experiment with creative and critical space for the emergence of renewed social and cultural movements.

gradMethod.ch:
Attendance and Participation        15 ％
Oral Presentation 15 ％
Midterm Exam        25 ％
Reading Journals  20 ％
Final Paper 25 ％  
*You must complete all assignments to pass the course.

ch.competencies: 高級英文閱讀解析與寫作論述

en.competencies: advanced English critical reading and analytical writing
literature search， synthesis， and critical analysis
